summary:
This mods adds a new set of Armor to the game, a heavy armor called Carved Ivory Armor. It is
lighter, stronger, and more expensive than Ebony Armor, but not as good as DragonBone or Daedric
armor.
descriptionHtml:
Carved Ivory Armor - Skyrim Mod created by Lazarus Trout



VERSIONS
-------------
There are 2 variations of this mod:

Variation 1 is a "lite" version. It does not modify ANY vanilla objects in the game.

Variation 2 is a more "full featured" version. It modifies some vanilla "Leveled Item"
objects and adds a new category to the "Smithing" perk tree.



FILE CONTENTS
---------------------
Variation 1 is included in the archive file LazT_CI_Lite.ZIP and contains the following files:

LazT_CI_Lite.ESP
LazT_CI_Lite.BSA
READ_ME.TXT


Variation 2 is included in the archive file LazT_CI_Full.ZIP and contains the following files:

LazT_CI_Full.ESP
LazT_CI_Full.BSA
READ_ME.TXT




D E S C R I P T I O N :
--------------------------------
This mods adds a new set of Armor to the game, a heavy armor called "Carved Ivory Armor." It is
lighter, stronger, and more expensive than Ebony Armor, but not as good as DragonBone or Daedric
armor. A shield is not included, but could be added in future updates.

There are 2 variations to this mod: A "Lite" version that does not modify ANY vanilla objects in
the game and a more "full featured" version that modifies a few vanilla "Leveled Item" objects and
adds a new category to the "Smithing" perk tree.

Variation 1 includes a single set of armor, which can be found in a non-respawing player chest in
Whiterun. (Located behind the Drunken Huntsman.)

Variation 2 includes the same set of armor in the same player chest, but also adds the ability to
create Carved Ivory Armor at any blacksmith forge. (It will appear under the "Misc" category.)
NOTE: In order to craft Carved Ivory Armor, you must first obtain the "CarvedIvory Smithing" perk
in the Smithing perk tree. You can also improve Carved Ivory Armor at any Armorer's workbench.
In addition, Variation 2 adds Carved Ivory Armor to "Leveled Item" lists, so that you may receive
Carved Ivory Armor when looting containers, receiving rewards, or by purchasing from vendors who
sell armor. This includes over 200 enchanted variants of the plain Carved Ivory Armor.

I hope that you enjoy this mod. (If so, please endorse!) NOTE: The NIF meshes for this armor are
based partly on the "Ebony Armory" models in the vanilla game and partly on the "Ancient Falmer
Armor" models in the Dawnguard DLC, all of which was provided by Bethesda. Many diffuse textures
and almost all normal textures used for them models in this mod were modified (and in some cases
completely re-created) to create Carved Ivory Armor.



TAGS
--------
Armor/shields
Items - Leveled
Magic - Enchantments
English
Lore-Friendly
New Textures
Leveled Lists
Fair and balanced
For male characters
For female characters


INSTALLATION
-------------------
To install the "Lite" of this mod, download and extract LazT_CI_Lite.ZIP and copy the files
LazT_CI_Lite.ESP and LazT_CI_Lite.BSA to your Skyrim DATA folder. This folder is normally
located at "C:Program Files (x86)SteamSteamAppscommonskyrimData"

To install the "Full" of this mod, download and extract LazT_CI_Full.ZIP and copy the files
LazT_CI_Full.ESP and LazT_CI_Full.BSA to your Skyrim DATA folder. This folder is normally
located at "C:Program Files (x86)SteamSteamAppscommonskyrimData"



COMPATIBILITY
-------------
No DLC required.

This mod is not dependent on any other mods.

The "Lite" version of this mod should not conflict with ANY other mods. A player chest containing
the Ivory Armor, plus a few small trees to hide it from view, have been added to Whiterun, behind
The Drunken Huntsman. No other changes were made to any other cells in the game. No changes were
made to any vanilla objects in the "Lite" version of the mod.

The "Full" version of this mod should not conflict with MOST other mods. A player chest containing
the Ivory Armor, plus a few small trees to hide it from view, have been added to Whiterun, behind
The Drunken Huntsman. No other changes were made to any other cells in the game. SOME changes were
made to a few vanilla objects in the "Full" version of the mod. Specifically, new Leveled Items and
Leveled Item Sublists were added to existing "Loot List" Leveled Item Objects. Other mods that have
modified the same "Loot List" objects could conflict with this one. (In which case, the LAST mod to
appear in the load stack will take priority, possibly causing the prior mod's loot to not appear or
to not appear as often.) This mod makes changes to the "Smithing" perk tree, and could conflict
with any mod that makes changes to the "Smithing" perk tree. (Again, the LAST mod to appear in the
load stack will supersede any prior mods.)



PERMISSIONS
-----------
Feel free to include, convert, re-use, or re-distribute this mod (including any of the assets it
contains) as long as you give proper credit in your mod's description. There is no need to obtain
permission from me. Do not modify and re-upload or re-release updated versions of THIS mod without
contacting me. I can be reached via NexusMods.com if you have any questions or comments.



ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS
----------------
Thanks to Bethesda Softworks for creating SKYRIM and the CREATION KIT.

Thanks to Havok for creating NIFTOOLS, specifically NIFSKOPE.

Thanks to Fawzib Rojas for creating BSA BROWSER.

Thanks to Spencer Kimball, Peter Mattis and the GIMP Development Team for creating the GNU Impage
Manipulation Program.

Thanks to Robin Scott and everyone at NexusMods.com for providing an online venue for indispensable
forum discussions and the means to distribute and share mods.
author: Lazarus Trout
